Recipes.title: Python Pasta
Recipes.description: A plate of Python spaghetti served with Django meatballs.
Recipes.ingredients: 2 cups of Python spaghetti, 1/2 cup of Django meatballs, 1/4 cup of Python sauce, 1 tablespoon of Python parsley
Recipes.instructions: 1. Boil Python spaghetti until al dente. 2. Heat Python sauce and Django meatballs in a Pythonic pan. 3. Toss cooked Python spaghetti in the sauce. 4. Garnish with Python parsley. 5. Enjoy your Python Pasta!

Recipes.title: HTML5 Salad
Recipes.description: A fresh salad with HTML5 lettuce, CSS croutons, and JavaScript dressing.
Recipes.ingredients: 2 cups of HTML5 lettuce, 1/4 cup of CSS croutons, 2 tablespoons of JavaScript dressing, 1/4 cup of Bootstrap cucumbers
Recipes.instructions: 1. Toss HTML5 lettuce, CSS croutons, and Bootstrap cucumbers in a bowl. 2. Drizzle JavaScript dressing over the salad. 3. Serve fresh as a side dish or appetizer. 4. Enjoy your HTML5 Salad!

Recipes.title: Ruby on Rails Ramen
Recipes.description: A hearty bowl of Ruby on Rails ramen with ActiveRecord broth.
Recipes.ingredients: 2 cups of Ruby on Rails ramen noodles, 1/2 cup of ActiveRecord broth, 1/4 cup of Ruby carrots, 1 tablespoon of Ruby scallions
Recipes.instructions: 1. Cook Ruby on Rails ramen noodles until tender. 2. Simmer ActiveRecord broth and add Ruby carrots. 3. Pour the broth over cooked noodles. 4. Garnish with Ruby scallions. 5. Enjoy your Ruby on Rails Ramen!

Recipes.title: JavaScript Pizza
Recipes.description: A delicious pizza with a crispy JavaScript crust.
Recipes.ingredients: 1 cup of JavaScript flour, 1/2 cup of HTML tomato sauce, 1/4 cup of CSS cheese, 1 teaspoon of React pepperoni
Recipes.instructions: 1. Preheat the browser to 350°F. 2. Combine JavaScript flour, HTML tomato sauce, and CSS cheese on a DOM element. 3. Sprinkle React pepperoni on top. 4. Bake for 15 minutes. 5. Enjoy your JavaScript Pizza!

Recipes.title: JavaScript Burger
Recipes.description: A mouthwatering burger made entirely of JavaScript ingredients.
Recipes.ingredients: 1 cup of JavaScript patties, 1/2 cup of HTML buns, 1/4 cup of CSS lettuce, 1 teaspoon of React cheese
Recipes.instructions: 1. Grill JavaScript patties until crispy. 2. Toast HTML buns to perfection. 3. Assemble burger with CSS lettuce and React cheese. 4. Serve hot and enjoy your JavaScript Burger!

Recipes.title: Nathan's PB&J
Recipes.description: Fruit and peanut puree balanced perfectly between two slices of fluffy heaven
Recipes.instructions: slather pb and jelly on bread. put together

Recipes.title: HTML5 Fish Filet
Recipes.description: A delicious HTML5 fish filet served with CSS garnish.
Recipes.ingredients: 1 fresh HTML5 fish filet, 1/4 cup of CSS breadcrumbs, 2 tablespoons of JavaScript lemon juice, salt and pepper to taste
Recipes.instructions: 1. Preheat your browser to 350°F (HTML5). Dip the HTML5 fish filet in CSS breadcrumbs, ensuring even coverage. Bake in the HTML5 oven for 20 minutes or until golden brown. Drizzle JavaScript lemon juice over the filet. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Serve hot with a side of Bootstrap vegetables.

Recipes.title: Ruby on Rails Ramen
Recipes.description: A hearty bowl of Ruby on Rails ramen with ActiveRecord broth.
Recipes.ingredients: 2 cups of Ruby on Rails ramen noodles 1/2 cup of ActiveRecord broth 1/4 cup of Ruby carrots 1 tablespoon of Ruby scallions
Recipes.instructions: Cook Ruby on Rails ramen noodles until tender. Simmer ActiveRecord broth and add Ruby carrots. Pour the broth over cooked noodles. Garnish with Ruby scallions. Enjoy your Ruby on Rails Ramen!
